298: DescriptionChildren's Home & Aid invites you to join our team of mission-driven staff who share a common vision: an equitable world where all children and families thrive in strong communities. As a leading child and family service agency with more than 20 locations across Illinois, our mission is to advance the well-being of children by investing in families to disrupt the systemic and multi-generational cycle of racial, social and economic inequality.Our full-time staff receive competitive salaries and a generous benefits package, including a paid leave accrual rate that starts at two weeks annually and grows to more than five weeks of paid time off each year, as well as a paid winter break that occurs the week between Christmas Day and New Year's Day. We strive to hold ourselves and each other accountable for fostering an inclusive work culture where we can be our authentic selves, where we create and have equitable opportunities, and where our voices are supported and encouraged.The Payroll Specialist oversees the agency's payroll records, reporting, and operations. As the Payroll Specialist, you'll be part of the Finance team, and have primary responsibility for accurate and timely payroll processing and records management. The Payroll Specialist serves as primary resource for managing employee payroll data and reporting needs for all stakeholders and reports to the Director of Finance.What you'll do :+ Process payroll in an accurate and timely manner; monitor time and attendance information for 800+ agency employees.+ Ensure security and confidentiality of payroll data.+ Process all earning deductions and charges including garnishments, manual checks, check reversal and stop payments.+ Establish and maintain payroll process documentation and standard internal operating procedures.+ Maintain all payroll records in a highly secure and organized manner (both electronic and hard copy) in accordance with agency, funder, government, and other applicable standards.+ Collaborate with the Human Resource Department, Information Technology Department, and other Finance staff on payroll-related issues.+ Maintain current knowledge of government requirements and regulations related to payroll information and record-keeping and ensure payroll practices are compliant.+ Complete internal payroll analyses.Who you are:+ Associate's Degree in Accounting, Finance, Human Resources, or a related field, or equivalent experience required. Bachelor's Degree preferred.+ Advanced knowledge of UltiPro system highly desirable.+ At least five years of experience managing payroll operations for an agency of 500+ employees required.+ Experience working with third party auditors from regulatory bodies preferred.+ You are a highly organized self-starter with strong problem-solving orientation and attention to detail.The details:+ Location : Hybrid (At least 2 days per week in Office after initial training): 200 West Monroe Street+ Schedule : Full-time, hourly; general business hours with some flexibility for special projects.+ Staff are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and to submit proof of their vaccination status before their start date unless they have an agency approved medical or religious exemption.Compensation & Benefits:+ Salary: Range starts at $24/hr+ Noncash benefits: Medical/dental/vision insurance, paid time off plus 11 paid holidays, supplemental insurance options, 401(k) with match (more benefits details here ( )+ Winter Break: The agency is closed between Christmas Day and New Year's Day. This paid break allows staff to spend time with their families around the holidays without using their accrued time off balances.+ Student Loan Forgiveness: Children's Home & Aid is an approved agency for Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF)Where you work matters.You're considering a new position, so no one knows better than you that where you work matters.
